episode_summary: This episode covers a range of topics including the peculiarities of British elections, the cultural significance of color in hunting and nature, a Buddhist temple in Japan with a space program, and the genetics of cat colors.

facts.fact: British elections couldn't go ahead without a device called the spanker.
The Never Pink movement refers to hunters in the US who refuse to wear pink clothing, even though it gives them more chance of shooting their prey and makes them less likely to be shot themselves.
Monks working at the 2800 year old Buddhist temple Daigoji in Japan maintain a five-story pagoda, a cherry blossom garden, and a space program.
Cats only come in two colors.
